mTree 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Calculate Effect Statistics

get_mtree_stats.Rd

Calculate Effect Statistics

Usage

get_mtree_stats(data, treatment, outcome, covariates, tree, cens_var = NULL)

Arguments

data

Data frame.

treatment

Character. Name of the treatment column in data

outcome

Character. Name of the outcome column in data

covariates

Character vector. Vector of covariate column names from data to use in match

tree

Decision tree obtained from get_mtree().

cens_var

Character. Name of a censoring column in data. If none exists, leave NULL. Default: NULL

Value

Data frame with effect estimates

Examples

covariates <- c("age", "stage4", "site", "ecog", "prevTrt", "diseaseFree")
matches <- get_filtered_matches(
  example_trial_data,
  treatment = "Z",
  covariates = covariates
)
#> ℹ You did not provide a value for `id`, so we created a unique id called `id`
#> ℹ You did not provide an indicator of categorical variables via `ind_categorical`, so we guessed that stage4, site, ecog, prevTrt, and diseaseFree are categorical.

#> ! Dropping pair 0_107 and 1_197 because prevTrt did not exactly match between groups.
#> ! Dropping pair 0_114 and 1_198 because prevTrt did not exactly match between groups.
m <- get_averaged_matches(
  matches,
  treatment = "Z",
  outcome = "Y",
  covariates = covariates
  )
tree <- get_mtree(m, covariates)
get_mtree_stats(example_trial_data,
  treatment = "Z",
  outcome = "Y",
  covariates = covariates,
  tree = tree)
#> $est
#> data$predNode: 1
#>   x1  n1   p1 x0  n0   p0  diff lower  upper
#> 1 59 100 0.59 76 100 0.76 -0.17 -0.27 -0.045
#>
